pros: I love working here. They have recovered from covid and a big move with grace. There has been a shift in culture with both but management is doing all they can to normalize the environment. It will take time and it is the same in every other medical environment. These last three years have been fast, furious, and OUT OF CONTROL! Our director is always available, has an open door policy, listens to our concerns, and does what the c-suite allows her to. I am thankful for my pod and my entire team. I coulnd't work for a better company or office that is interested in their employees and our work life balance.
cons: Upper management, not the management at primary care.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fruita, CO
pros: Family Health West really is a family. They value medical care over money.
cons: There are no cons that I have experienced.

pros: Close to downtown Fruita. But THAT'S IT!
cons: Very top heavy and toxic from the CEO all the way down the org chart! The former CEO was WAY better and didn't care and judge people based on how well they stroked his ego. The CEO and his cronies are so out of touch with reality and have zero management common sense, including making sure the organization is NOT culturally diverse! They'd rather keep inept and over paid VP's/managers so long as they stroke the CEO's unqualified and inflated ego. No wonder their new logo looks JUST like a toxic warning label !!! It's the perfect brand for them!

pros: this place is really like working with family.
cons: Need more office managers and less moving of practices

pros: Good coworkers, patients were great
cons: Terrible management, toxic environment, treated horribly

pros: Small hospital where everyone knows everyone.
cons: Hospital administration has know idea what they are doing. Prefers to lead by intimidation

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Fruita, CO
pros: The coworkers are motivated and friendly
cons: Some of the online programs don't work as well as they should

job_title: Certified Professional Coder in Fruita, CO
pros: Amazing people and the Administration really cares
cons: The computer systems are not user friendly

pros: Caring staff and supportive management
cons: Have to wear many hats and allocate occasionally limited resources

pros: Friendly staff and supportive management
cons: Wear many hats, sometimes not enough resources

pros: Small and local community hospital
cons: Staffing is on and off

pros: Great boss and coworkers, training constantly, good work flow even with new EHR. Family atmosphere right up to the CEO.
cons: Salary reflects small town environment, but low cost, excellent benefits more than make up for it. So not really a con.

review_title: Good caring faclilty, wonderful place to work.
pros: Always willing to help you further your education.
cons: The parking is poor for the employee's and wages are below average.

pros: Good pay, great benefits and amazing support.
cons: Staffing was a challenge  and financials were usually tight but typical in most nonprofit healthcare environments.

pros: Some of the people that work there are helpful and caring.
cons:
Turnover is extremely high, they are religiously bias (most if not all upper management belong to the  same church ).
Didn’t seem to care about the patients well being.
Unethical physical and occupational therapy practices.

job_title: Data Entry in Grand Junction, CO
pros: Not very demanding and can listen music or podcasts while you work.
cons: Very repetitive work with not always clear standards
